topic.title: COPI Abstract

body.p: The Combined OTN and Packet Interface (COPI) provides Interlaken interfaces to transfer client data between the Central Packet Buffer (DCPB) and peer Interlaken devices. The COPI operates on a mix of up to 190 channels of OTN and packet traffic (of which up to 120 channels can carry packet traffic) carried to and from the DCPB. The COPI operates either in 1x500G mode with a single Interlaken interface or in 3x200G mode with three Interlaken interfaces. A third mode, 1x600G, is available for a single Interlaken channel for PIF traffic only. The COPI transmit (fabric ingress) path performs burst validation, channel ID remapping, and header insertion before sending traffic to the Interlaken interfaces. The COPI receive (fabric egress) path accepts data from the Interlaken interfaces and performs burst validation, channel filtering, channel ID remapping and header extraction. The Interlaken interfaces transfer packets in segments or bursts with in-band flow control, and support 25.78125 Gbps / 28.125 Gbps / 53.125 Gbps / 56.25 Gbps rates. The COPI integrates the ITS_PKT500 block which provides up to 500G of test packet generation and monitoring over 120 channels. The COPI can be configured to merge the generated test traffic with the receive datapath toward the DCPB or else merge with the transmit datapath coming out of the DCPB toward the Interlaken interfaces. The COPI can be configured to monitor test traffic received or transmitted between the DCPB and Interlaken interfaces. The COPI can also measure OTN packet traffic datapath latency on the receive path before sending the packets to the DCPB.
